intro: Licania monteagudensis, commonly known as the Monteagudo licania, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, alternate leaves, and showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitat.
